arguments.question: process for voluntary termination and final pay

messages.content:
### Clause 7.4 – Voluntary Termination and Final Pay
When an employee voluntarily resigns, they must provide at least two weeks' written notice. Upon the employee's last working day, the company will:
- Pay all earned salary up to and including the termination date.
- Include any accrued but unused vacation days.
- Provide a final paycheck no later than the next regular payroll cycle.
Failure to give notice may result in forfeiture of unused vacation payout.
